thread.title: Former Speaker Boehner: Repealing And Replacing Obamacare 'Not Going To Happen'
thread.title_full: Former Speaker Boehner: Repealing And Replacing Obamacare 'Not Going To Happen'

title: Former Speaker Boehner: Repealing And Replacing Obamacare 'Not Going To Happen'
text:
Speaking at a health care conference Thursday in Orlando, Fla., former Speaker of the House John Boehner called plans to repeal and replace the Affordable Care Act “happy talk.”
Rather than a complete overhaul, Boehner said, Obamacare will probably receive only “relatively modest” changes.
“[Congressional Republicans are] going to fix Obamacare — I shouldn’t call it repeal-and-replace, because it’s not going to happen,” Boehner told the crowd.
  Obamacare Architect Ezekiel Emanuel Joins Fox News As Contributor Ryan’s Optimistic Pledge: ‘Most Productive Presidency And Congress In Our Lifetimes’ In Response To Trump, IRS Takes A Swing At Key Provision Of Obamacare He called the idea of a speedy replacement to former President Barack Obama’s signature health care plan “wildly optimistic.”
The Freedom Caucus , made up of conservative Republican members of the House, confirmed its commitment to repealing and replacing Obamacare in a tweet Thursday morning.
We made a promise to the American people. The Freedom Caucus remains 100% committed to full repeal & replace https://t.co/qcwkk6wjvZ 
— House Freedom Caucus (@freedomcaucus) February 23, 2017 

Advertisement – story continues below
Current House Speaker Paul Ryan made an announcement last week that contradicts Boehner’s assessment of GOP lawmakers’ commitment to deliver on their promise.
Ryan promised to present a bill aimed at repealing and replacing Obamacare when Congress returns to work next week.
In a news conference Feb. 16, Ryan remarked, “It has become increasingly clear that this law is collapsing,” adding, “It will keep getting worse unless we act.”
  ICE:   ‘Mad Dog’ Mattis Takes Only Three Hours Of Rest Before Returning To Work As McCain Steps Up Criticism Of Trump, He Makes Surprise Trip To Syria Despite Ryan’s insistence that a new plan will be rolled out soon, Boehner expressed his doubts.
He told those attending the conference, “I started laughing. Republicans never ever agree on health care.”
“Most of the framework of the Affordable Care Act … that’s going to be there,” he added.
Boehner resigned as speaker in 2015 amid unrest from conservatives in the party.
What do you think?
